verses.roman:
nirjharete uṣṇodake snāna tina-bāra
dui-sandhyā agni-tāpa kāṣṭhera apāra

synonyms: nirjharete—in the waterfalls; uṣṇa-udake—in warm water; snāna—bath; tina-bāra—thrice; dui-sandhyā—morning and evening; agni-tāpa—heating by a fire; kāṣṭhera—of wood; apāra—without limit.
translation: The Lord used to bathe three times a day in the warm water of the waterfalls. He also used to heat Himself morning and evening with a fire made of the limitless wood.
